channel.title: Copy of Digg top 24 hours
channel.description: RSS feed with direct links to popular technology articles. based on superdigg pipe

item.title: [+2256] The Sanctity Of Marriage
item.description: Who gave the government the right to say who gets married anyway? It's an arrangement between two people.

item.title: [+1927] How to remove the Digg Dragon Age ad.
item.description: How to remove the irritating ad and restore background colour and comment width to normal.

item.title: [+1788] WTF Pictures Compilation (76 pics)
item.description: An excellent selection of strange, unexplained and at the same time funny and amusing photos is waiting for you inside the post.

item.title: [+1429] Teabaggers attack Holocaust survivor Elie Wiesel
item.description: Wiesel, a survivor of the Holocaust, took issue with the Teabagger movement's disgusting comparisons of health care reform to Nazi death camps. The 'Baggers responded with typical class: "The jews need to clam up and accept the fact that they are in a Christian country." "This hollowcost thing is totally overblown by the jewish." Disgusting.

item.title: [+1411] Are You Smarter Than A 1954 8th Grader?
item.description: Need a way to measure just how far our public school system has fallen? Are we even teaching our children civics in school today? The status quo cannot be acceptable. Could you pass this test?

item.title: [+1245] Lost army of 50,000 found
item.description: The remains of a mighty Persian army said to have drowned in the sands of the western Egyptian desert 2,500 years ago might have been finally located.

item.title: [+939] What Beautiful HTML Code Looks Like [inforgraphic]
item.description: In HTML, it comes down to craftsmanship. Let’s take a look at some markup written they way markup should be written and see how beautiful it can be.

item.title: [+934] The Social Security Shituation (INFOGRAPHIC)
item.description: How does Social Security work? What’s this about Social Security running out? All the details on the past, present, and future of Social Security .

item.title: [+924] Rupert Murdoch Gone Mental: Removing Sites from Google
item.description: Rupert Murdoch has suggested that News Corporation is likely to make its content unfindable to users on Google when it launches its paid content strategy .

item.title: [+720] How to Upgrade Your Kid (VIDEO)
item.description: This is Neville wearing his requested "Thanatos" mech costume made of cardboard and toilet paper rolls and spray paint.

item.title: [+659] This is how my neighbor's Dog Sleep
[+632] Carl Sagan remembered
item.description: Astronomy | Today is Carl Sagan's 75th birthday. It would be nice if he were still around to send him the greeting personally, but sadly, he died too young...

item.title: [+584] Colgate's Brilliant Ad Reminds You to Brush After You Eat
item.description: The stick carrying the ice cream and cotton candy carries a hidden message. Once consumers are done the message printed on the tip of the stick shaped like a toothbrush reveals “Don’t Forget” with the Colgate logo.

item.title: [+573] Digital Distraction Hierarchy (PYRAMID CHART)
item.description: In a digital age rife with an endless stream of distraction, from email updates to text messages, it’s important that we get our priorities straight. This handy hierarchy helps ensure that your limited attention span is always focused on the most important detail of the moment.

item.title: [+554] 90+ International Google Doodles You May Not Have Seen
item.description: I am a big Google Doodles fan and here I have selected some of the most beautiful Google Doodles from different countries for you.
